cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 167 (Wednesday, November 13, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. PALMER:H.J. Res. 220.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:To disapprove of the rule submitted by the Bureau ofConsumer Financial Protection relating to ``Debt CollectionPractices (Regulation F); Deceptive and Unfair Collection ofMedical Debt''.[Page H5976]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bill.title: Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to "Debt Collection Practices (Regulation F); Deceptive and Unfair Collection of Medical Debt".

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
